reviews.review_msg: Your grades (participation, assignment, final) are all marked by your same TA (get a guy) The topics for essays/finals were ok as long as you have good arguments and make good notes/read books. Lectures r important for final topics. It is unfair that one person makes decisions for how well we argue in our essays. We should be able to dispute marks.
Really great lecturer and makes even the most boring book seem interesting. Encourages participation and discussion and has a great sense of humour!

Susan was a great professor - you can tell that she really cares about her students and the subject matter. Although at times, lectures could be somewhat dull and too straightforward. The texts chosen were very interesting and fun to read. She loves participation though - so get ready to speak up!

Dr. Brook is incredibly sweet and helpful. English lectures are usually boring but she tries her best to keep things mildly entertaining by showing related videos; she also gives solid advice on how to structure writing. The texts she chose for the course were interesting enough. I went to her office hours once and found her advice very helpful.
Great guy. Straight forward lectures. Tutorial particpation necessary.
very clear lectures!
Professor Fleming is a quality professor. He is witty and caring. His lectures are insightful and engaging. I would recommend him as a professor because he is very organized with remote schooling.

Papers depend more on your TA than anything else but final was easy. Just write down what he says word for word (no point form, verbatim) and regurgitate it on the paper. There's easier W credits but if you're interested in the subject matter it's not bad.

He's awful. He seems pretty knowledgeable of his subject but the way he teaches isn't so easy to understand and it is really hard for 1st year students(especially those who are not major in English) to get what he teaches. I wouldn't recommend him.

English is my least favourite subject but Colette made this an enjoyable class.  The lectures were informative in that it helped facilitate discussion in tutorial, and helped with the blog/essay writing, and probably writing the final too.  Lectures went at a good pace, but can be a bit dry at times due to the content itself.

Lectures are very boring. Not necessary to attend as she often talks about information that is not examinable. Marking depends upon your TA. Make sure to keep up with readings as there are quite a few every week. Marking is very well balanced with nothing being worth more than 20%. Overall, not a difficult class.
Clear expectations, good feedback, engaging lecturer.

Carolyn would greatly benefit from advocating and caring about the well-being of her students in her classes and the English department. I strongly recommend avoiding enrollment in any of her classes.

Carolyn is AMAZING. Such a nice lady. 3 papers, 1 final. 5 books to read + lots of online readings and a couple films (a lot of work). She made everything so much more interesting than it seemed. TA's grade a little tough on the papers

I loved this class. Dr. Budra is a lovely individual who made lectures, although online, very enjoyable. The marking is done by your TA, but the criteria for both papers were very fair. His exam was also very fair and if you read the books and lectures there is no reason you should not do well!

Professor Budra was a solid choice for a 100 level english class. His lectures were entertaining and very in depth, I didnt even have to read all the materials. Your whole grade does depend on your TA though. Overall it was my favourite out of the two english courses I took. I dont enjoy english but I would take this class again.

He summarised and explained the assigned books and stories really well. He ensured that the material was interesting. Plus, there was never a dull moment in class. However, all the marking was done by the TA's so I can't really say anything about Paul when it comes to that. He was generous enough to give a 5% bonus to everyone in class though :D

very funny jolly man . very easy and enjoying course. no final exam. 2 writing in class but topics are known in advance. grading for essays are not tough and there is one creative presentation in tutorial. However i didn't enjoy the texts he required :(

His lectures covered the reading material super well, I didn't purchase any of the textbooks but attended all lectures and I felt as if I read the actual material. Essay topics were his discussion topics in lecture so overall was easy. Lectures aren't boring and he keeps them fairly interesting. Quite funny too! Doesn't allow laptops in lecture

Amazing professor. As an immigrant, I was always scared of English classes but she made it very doable. She helps you out to understand the essay prompt, and helps you brainstorm ideas and create your outline. She is super nice and accessible outside of class. The final was not essays, but rather short questions. Best Prof ever !!

Diana is a great prof in general, was passionate during lectures and even gave me an extension for TSIS quizzes since I made a mistake doing every single one. Unfortunately as a science student I didn't have a very good experience during the course because it's english but that doesn't change the fact that she's a great prof.

HANDS DOWN THE BEST ENGLISH PROF EVER. Dr. Solomon is an amazing lecturer and she is quite passionate about literature. As a science student who doesn't take English classes, I deeply enjoyed this class. Dr. Solomon Shows so much care and respect for her students and explains assignments, papers and exam criteria super clearly. 100% recommended.

Sophie was my favourite professor this semester! She loves connecting with her students and was extremely forgiving with extensions during and after the TSSU strike. The books she chooses are excellent starters and she always finds a way to make her lectures engaging. Her TAs are also amazing (shoutout to Tianne)!

the professor was overall very kind, she explains all the assignments in the lectures super well and gives more than enough time for each assignment to be submitted. The course is overall pretty easy if you follow your weekly readings and participate in your tutorials.

I loved class with Dr. McCall. She was a caring and warm professor and encouraged participation. I loved the texts we read in class, the lectures were interesting and she brought in 3 guest speakers! She was accommodating during the strike and I would take another ENGL class with her. However, sometimes her docs/outlines were disorganized a bit.

Sophie is an amazing professor and genuinely cares a lot for her students and for the world. All of the novels we read are incredible and dealt with real historical events. The grading comes from the TAs and is pretty difficult considering this is a first year course. However, I would definitely recommend this class for first all year students.

I found this class to be very easy to manage with Dr. Mccall! Her lectures were interesting, and she was super understanding. Also people complaining about reading are silly because that's what anyone should expect from an english course? We read 5 main texts, so it was not bad at all. I had Maya as my TA and she was awesome! Loved this class!
I thought that the professor was great. Class was very welcoming to first year students. Lectures provided good analysis of the books.

The prof knew his stuff and lectures were full of things you needed to do well on the final. I didn't go to lectures for the most part, and that is the reason for getting a B. Definitely go for lectures and tutorials are pretty straightforward. As for the creative project in the class, start working on it ASAP. Read text overviews in week 1-2.

His lectures were helpful for understanding the books, but they are not mandatory and skipping them would be fine if they are easy for you. Your mark is dependent on the TA's marking style. There is a final paper worth 35% of your mark and an exam worth 30%. The exam is easy because he provides the questions before the exam.

He is very welcoming and accommodating. Lectures were slightly boring, but helpful. Take notes, because he elaborates a lot about the readings and also goes through review questions. I had a good T.A., so that made things better as well. Overall, he can be draining for some people, but I enjoyed his class. Perfect for first-year English majors.

Super passionate and a compelling speaker. Attending lectures helps with understanding of readings. (There is a lot of reading so plan your reading and start reading before the course starts if you can.) Can be bit vague about essay structures and rules. Best to ask your TA about these. Would recommend, especially if you're into English.

Took this in my first semester. I decided early that English is not my thing, but Dr. Fleming's lectures were engaging and informative, and he made what would otherwise have been a slog an enjoyable class. He is a rather slow talker, but lectures were through Youtube (yay Covid...) so I bumped up the speed. Excellent for my first English course!

Dr. Sharren was an incredible prof! She made online class enjoyable with interesting lectures and discussions, and fostered a good community within the class. Weekly discussion posts, two essays and an exam were marked fairly (you do have to put in work!) but she gives helpful and direct feedback, which showed she really wants to see you succeed.

she was my prof for engl 115w. i really liked her classm but found that her style of lecturing was quite different than what i was used to -- she encouraged taking notes by hand, having mainly pictures and bits of text from the readings on the slide, and just analysed poems with us in class. she had a tough marking rubric but i learnt a lot!

I won't speak too much about her teaching style or how much she cares. This was an asynchronous remote class, I never once talked to her. I will say the materials in her class introduced me to some amazaing literature, some classic, some contemporary. And she really awakened a whole new perspective on nature, literatue and culture.
